con:part.con:content:
Schema Definition for ProductOffering Extension

 This collection describes the hierarchy to identify the parent and child of a product offering. This field represent the ID of the current hierarchy item. This field describes the name of the current hierarchy item. This field holds the description of a current hierarchy item. If the current element is a child, this element will contain the ID of the parent element. Otherwise, if current element is a root element, it will be empty or not present. A classification of the business object or component. This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component. The set of classifications for the business object or component. A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component. An indication of the hierarchy level of the category when involved in a hierarchical classification, e.g. level 1 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=1, level 2 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=2. In this case the listName should be the same for each level to show their relationship. The lifecycle state of the business object or component. This field is used to track the specific state an instance of an object or component is in, e.g. the Customer Bill is Active or the Customer Request has been Cancelled.

Schema Definition for Vodafone Fault Object

 A reference to the specific field or component within the VBO that generated the failure. The pseudo-XPath reference to the specific field or component within the VBO. The value of the field referenced by the Path Name. A component that describes individual failures within the fault. This component is used to support multiple causes to the fault, i.e. where the fault is generated from one or more API calls or one or more validation failures. The code identifying the specific failure. The human-readable text of the specific failure. A reference to the specific field or component within the VBO that generated the failure. The fault object used to hold in-house Vodafone values for an error occurring within a middleware component, intended to be used as part of a SOAP:detail tag within the fault as per the SOAP 1.1 specification. A human readable short text name for the fault. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Success" if the object is being used to indicate success. The degree of severity and impact the fault has inccured, provides an indication of the level that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Information" if the object is being used to indicate success. A classification of the fault indicating whether it has been generated through some technical aspect of the interaction or on account of a failure of business logic, rules or processing. It provides an indication of the type that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Business" if the object is being used to indicate success. An enumeration of the reasons why the fault has been generated by the provider. Currently this is not used. A human readable description of the fault as identified by the Error Code. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Successfully processed" if the object is being used to indicate success. A component that allows characteristics of the fault to be specified in addition to those specifically asked for, e.g. Category, Severity, etc. A characteristic of the fault, these have both a name and a value. A component that describes individual failures within the fault. This component is used to support multiple causes to the fault, i.e. where the fault is generated from one or more API calls or one or more validation failures. Do not use in domain specific schema, provided for the sole purpose of generating examples. Schema definition for ProductOffering. The set of characteristics for the specification. The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component. The name of the characteristic Price Value of the component which includes Tax and Discount details. A type definition for ProductOffering Details A type definition for ProductOffering Support The Product Offering service is an Entity service that provides capabilities to retrieve the set of records held by an Organisation that it sells or enables Customers to subscribe to. A type definition for Related ProductOffering Type A type defining a reference to an Account, whether that be a Service Account, Loyalty Account or Product Stock. Generic Actor type object used to define roles. A type that supports the main body of an Adjustment business object. It supports both a direct credit or debit against an Account as well as a Balance Transfer from another Account. A reference to the Account to make the adjustment against. The sign of the Amount/Quantity is indicates whether this needs to be a Credit or Debit. A reference to the Account from which to transfer the Amount/Quantity from. The Amount/Quantity to transfer is held within the component. The Amount to transfer from/to the Transfer Account. The Quantity to transfer from/to the Transfer Account, if non-monetary values are required. A reference to another business object that triggered the Adjustment. The type of the business object being referenced, i.e. Advanced Shipment Notification or Sales Order. An aggregate function that allows statistics function to be specified for building the report The path to the field on which to make the calculation. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference. A definition of the costs associated with this feasibility request. The Net amount of the total amount. The amount of tax paid on the amount. A group of Authorizations required from the Business Participants involved in the entity being approved. The date and time the approval was created. The date and time the approval was requested. The date and time the approval was completed. A free text description of the outcome of the approval. Stores embedded base64 encoded data. Used to carry documents, images, etc. within the parent business object. The size in Bytes of the of the document or attachment. If this component contains the embedded data then the size is the size of the embedded data, if it is a reference without the data then it is the size of the referenced document. A reference to an external document. Base type for all business objects and some components. A classification of the business object or component. This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component. The set of classifications for the business object or component. A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component. An indication of the hierarchy level of the category when involved in a hierarchical classification, e.g. level 1 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=1, level 2 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=2. In this case the listName should be the same for each level to show their relationship. The lifecycle state of the business object or component. This field is used to track the specific state an instance of an object or component is in, e.g. the Customer Bill is Active or the Customer Request has been Cancelled. A business day is considered every official working day of the week. Another common term is working day. Typically, these are the days between and including Monday to Friday and do not include public holidays and weekends. The definition of a business day varies by region. It depends on the local work week which is dictated by local customs, religions, and business operations. For example, in the United States and much of the Western world, they are typically Monday to Friday. Within a few gulf countries the normal business days are Sunday to Thursday. A day is a unit of time. Each day of the week is named in different languages after classical planets, various deities. In English, the names are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Indicates if a given day is a business day or not. Represents the business hours for a given business day. For example, 09:00 hrs - 17:00 hrs. Description of a business day. An indication of whether the channel preference was given as consent by the consenter. The specific channel the preference applies to. An indication of whether explicit permission has been given for the preference. The threshold value for the explicit permission/preference. The period over which the preference is valid. A characteristic, normally used through a Specification. This allows traits of the parent business object to be configured. The name of the characteristic. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value) The value of the characteristic. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value) The set of characteristics for the specification. The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component. The name of the characteristic The value of the characteristic A classification of the characteristic component. This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component. A free text description of the characteristic. The date and time the characteristic was created. The from and to dates when the object is valid. The collation (sort) algorithm to use in the sorting to the result set Condition The set of job functions that the contact person is employed for. A specific job function of the contact person Job Title e.g Manager, CEO, Consultant etc The seniority of the contact person. The set of contact preferences for the contact person. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the "primary key" of the target object. Indicates if the current contact point is the preferred one. The full email address e.g. peter.jackson@vodafone.com The domain e.g. vodafone.com The username e.g. peter.jackson Whether the email address is a verified one or not An Event happens at a Point in Time. An Event will always be the result of an Activity and often Triggers another Activity. Extended Common base type for all Vodafone Objects. This also includes Status. A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a business object or component. This field should be used in support of multi-agent environments to control the concurrency (locking) of the instance. The date and time the business object or component was created. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used. The unique ID of the User that created the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User. The date and time the business object or component was last modified. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used. The unique ID of the User that last modified the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User. A component that states the date and time from which this business object is effective (or valid) and the date and time to which it is effective. Again the ISO8601 standard must be used. A field representing the date and time on which business activity was last made on this business object or component. The date and time must conform to the ISO8601 standard. The type code for the fax The subscriber number The local area code for the fax The measure of the altitude that reflects the vertical elevation of an object above a surface for this geographical coordinate (Reference ISO 6709 The measure of the latitude as an angular distance north or south from the Equator meridian to the meridian of a specific place for this geographical coordinate. (Reference ISO 6709) The measure of the longitude as an angular distance east or west from the Greenwich meridian to the meridian of a specific place (Reference ISO 6709) The indication of whether the latitude compass direction from the Equator meridian to the meridian of a specific place is North (+) or South (-). (Reference ISO 6709) The indication of whether the longitude as a compass direction from the Greenwich meridian to the meridian of a specific place is East (-) or West (+) for this geographical coordinate. (Reference ISO 6709) A unique identifier of the system used for measuring a geographical coordinate other than Global Positioning System The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component. Market Segments are the target of Marketing Campaigns, Product Offerings, Product Promotions, Product Placements, and Product Programs from both internal and external (Competitors, and other Providers) perspective. A Marketing Campaign is a coordinated series of steps that can include the promotion of a Product Offering through different mediums (television, radio, print, online) using a variety of different types of advertisements. The campaign doesn't have to rely solely on advertising. It can also include demonstrations, word of mouth and other interactive techniques. A Product Offering may target one or more Market Segments, be included in one or more Product Catalogue, presented in support of one or more Product Strategies, and made available in one or more Places. Product Offering may represent a simple offering of a single Product Specification or could represent a bundling of one or more other Product Offering. A public holiday, national holiday or legal holiday is a holiday generally established by law and is usually a non-working day during the year. The public holidays are generally days of celebration, like the anniversary of a significant historical event, or can be a religious celebration. Holidays can land on a specific day of the year, be tied to a certain day of the week in a certain month or follow other calendar systems like the Lunar Calendar. A sales account is a representation of a potential customer (prospect) around which sales activity is focused. A lead is the identification of an individual or organisation (Party) that has the interest and authority to purchase a product or service. This represents the first stage of a sales process. The identification of the lead is referred to as Lead Generation, a process conducted by either the marketing or sales organization. Thus, the Lead Entity in CIM is generated by the Lead Generation Interaction. This is a Party Interaction. The lead may have an organisation associated ( an Enterprise Sales Lead) with the individual(s). For potential Enterprise Customers, The lead is considered to be a role of Organisation since the Lead individual will not become a customer per se. The individual represents the company (Legal Entity) with which Vodafone hope to do business. An Opportunity is an opportunity to generate revenue from the account or lead. Opportunities are the pending deals that need to be tracked. Opportunities build the pipeline, which will contribute to the forecast. A Sales Order that was created from a Quote. A business day is considered every official working day of the week. Another common term is working day. Typically, these are the days between and including Monday to Friday and do not include public holidays and weekends. The definition of a business day varies by region. It depends on the local work week which is dictated by local customs, religions, and business operations. For example, in the United States and much of the Western world, they are typically Monday to Friday. Within a few gulf countries the normal business days are Sunday to Thursday. A day is a unit of time. Each day of the week is named in different languages after classical planets, various deities. In English, the names are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Indicates if a given day is a business day or not. Represents the business hours for a given business day. For example, 09:00 hrs - 17:00 hrs. Description of a business day. Market Segments are the target of Marketing Campaigns, Product Offerings, Product Promotions, Product Placements, and Product Programs from both internal and external (Competitors, and other Providers) perspective. A Marketing Campaign is a coordinated series of steps that can include the promotion of a Product Offering through different mediums (television, radio, print, online) using a variety of different types of advertisements. The campaign doesn't have to rely solely on advertising. It can also include demonstrations, word of mouth and other interactive techniques. A sales account is a representation of a potential customer (prospect) around which sales activity is focused. A lead is the identification of an individual or organisation (Party) that has the interest and authority to purchase a product or service. This represents the first stage of a sales process. The identification of the lead is referred to as Lead Generation, a process conducted by either the marketing or sales organization. Thus, the Lead Entity in CIM is generated by the Lead Generation Interaction. This is a Party Interaction. The lead may have an organisation associated ( an Enterprise Sales Lead) with the individual(s). For potential Enterprise Customers, The lead is considered to be a role of Organisation since the Lead individual will not become a customer per se. The individual represents the company (Legal Entity) with which Vodafone hope to do business. An Opportunity is an opportunity to generate revenue from the account or lead. Opportunities are the pending deals that need to be tracked. Opportunities build the pipeline, which will contribute to the forecast. A Sales Order that was created from a Quote. A type definition for CustomerMoneyTransfer Details Customer Money Transfer is an Entity service that provides capabilities to store records of money payments related to customers. It always stores information about single payment only. It represents the transfer of wealth from customer for products or services. It records money transfers for both inbound (charges) and outbound (refunds). A type definition for Related CustomerMoneyTransfer Type

About the XML namespace

This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.

See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.

Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The names currently defined in this namespace are listed below. They should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance.

See further below in this document for more information about how to refer to this schema document from your own XSD schema documents and about the namespace-versioning policy governing this schema document .

Father (in any context at all)

denotes Jon Bosak, the chair of the original XML Working Group. This name is reserved by the following decision of the W3C XML Plenary and XML Coordination groups:

In appreciation for his vision, leadership and dedication the W3C XML Plenary on this 10th day of February, 2000, reserves for Jon Bosak in perpetuity the XML name "xml:Father".

About this schema document

This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base , xml:lang , xml:space or xml:id attributes on elements they define.

To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows:

<schema . . .>
           . . .
           <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
                      schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd"/>

or

<import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
                      schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd"/>

Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.

<type . . .>
           . . .
           <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>

will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes.

Versioning policy for this schema document

In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd .

At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd .

The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd will not change.

Previous dated (and unchanging) versions of this schema document are at:

  • http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2007/08/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2004/10/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd

base (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.

id (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the xml:id specification.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.

lang (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

Notes

Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility.

See BCP 47 at http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt and the IANA language subtag registry at http://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry for further information.

The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.

space (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

Vodafone Business Message Schema Definition for ProductOffering

 Type definition for the GetProductOfferingList request payload. Type definition for the GetProductOfferingList response payload.

Schema Definition for Vodafone Header Object

Added element definition for all complextypes - 20-02-2015

 Use cache during queries by default (code may override this). Cache must be ignored, retrieve data from the back-end instead The service can decide whether or not to use a cache Mandatory cache parameter support by all services (a service must understand the directive even if no caching support in the service this allows for future extensibility of the service implementation) To understand the correlation between the execution of a service and from where it originated, MessageID and CorrelationID are mapped via WS-Addressing

An ISO3166-Alpha 2 Country Code should be used here.

A type representing the headers describing the destination or target system in an interaction. If used in the request message then this is an indication of the required destination and maybe used for routing. The original destination as understood by the source may be changed when the message is in flight. If used in the response message then this should be taken as a description of the actual destination (target) system.

 The Country Code of the destination system. This must adhere to the ISO3166-Alpha2 Country Codes. The Language Code of the destination system. This must adhere to the ISO639 Language Codes.

An ISO639 Language Code should be used here.

 A header providing meta-data about the result of a query. The total number of records matched in the query and possibly returned in the payload of the response message. The collation alogrithm that was used to sort the response to a query. A header providing additional routing discriminators that can be used in the context of routing rules The identifier of the route definition. This should be used to identify instances of routes. The priority of the Key relative to other Keys present in the same route. The set of additional keys for the routing purposes. The Key allows the consumer to pass aditional information relevant to the producer in order to perform the routing of the message to the appropriate system/component The name of the characteristic The priority of the Key relative to other Keys present in the same route. Documentation data structure exposes implementation details violates the service abstraction principle. To prevent consumers from using, any public service response or perimeter response must strip out the documentation data All request messages must have an identifiable source, or consumer information The Language Code of the source system. This must adhere to the ISO639 Language Codes. A header providing meta-data about the result of a query. A header providing additional routing discriminators that can be used in the context of routing rules

Schema Definition for Sales Partner Account Extension

Schema Definition for Sales Partner Account

 Schema definition for ProductOffering. A grouping of Parties, Geographic Areas, Sales Channels, and so forth. Market Segments are the target of Marketing Campaigns, Product Offerings, Product Promotions, Product Placements, and Product Programs from both internal and external (Competitors, and other Providers) perspective. Partner Programs allow Vodafone to manage and view customised programs for partners based on their level and program tier status Collection of SP Account related accounts Type definition for the SalesAccount. A sales account is a representation of a potential customer (prospect) around which sales activity is focused. A role to be undertaken for an interaction. Involvement roles are aggregated into Interactions Identifies additional details from SP Account Where amounts are defined in CIM there is always a UoM and a Pattern as well. That may make this redundant Indicator on partner accounts that the partner is allowed to register deals. Local Regional The number of Mobile Operators the account works with Also related to Payment Preference Indicator of whether we understand the competition and their customer relationships For PAM to override the automatic Business Plan eligibility (to render ineligible) Revenue generated by the partner in the current fiscal year. Revenue generated by the partner in the previous fiscal year. Indicates if balance sheet is attached Free text capturing the reason that the partner is not eligible for an account plan The VGE region of an account Partner's revenue % generated by mobile Partner's revenue % generated by IT business Partner's revenue % generated by Fixedline Partner's revenue % generated by OtherBusiness The Sales Partner account number Sales stucture employed by the partner. Revenue generated by the partner in the current fiscal year. Although this is free text attribute it should logically be a multi-select based on an Actor association Assumed to be revenue accrued by VF NOT the Revenue accrued by the '3rd party' Assumed to be revenue accrued by VF NOT the Revenue accrued by the '3rd party' Indicates partners specialization in terms of Vodafone product being sold. part of segmentation process, used for marketing analysi Identifier used for partner dealer locations. The difference between recommended and actual sales prices for the addon sales. An Event happens at a Point in Time. An Event will always be the result of an Activity and often Triggers another Activity. A role to be undertaken for an interaction. Involvement roles are aggregated into Interactions A role to be undertaken for an interaction. Involvement roles are aggregated into Interactions A role to be undertaken for an interaction. Involvement roles are aggregated into Interactions Type definition for the SalesPartnerAccount VBO. An Event happens at a Point in Time. An Event will always be the result of an Activity and often Triggers another Activity. This request allows partners to apply for a different tiering level within a Partner Program Note that this is a Partner Contact which does not fall within CRM Joint plan developed between Vodafone and a Sales Partner in cooperation with management at partner containing committed targets, as well as activity and investment plans for the partner to undertake. Partner Programs allow Vodafone to manage and view customised programs for partners based on their level and program tier status Note that this is a Partner Contact which does not fall within CRM Partner Programs allow Vodafone to manage and view customised programs for partners based on their level and program tier status Note that this is a Partner Contact which does not fall within CRM
